comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to NYT of Feb 1, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9C02E1DE1E39E633A... Harry A Wheeler of Chicago was president of the Chamber of Commerce of the United States. I think I can see the end of "Chicago" under the photographer's name (Moffett)

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started a Wikipedia entry for him: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_A._Wheeler Harry A. Wheeler (May 26, 1866 - January 23, 1960), was President of the United States Chamber of Commerce. In 1914 he declined President Wilsons invitation to join the Federal Reserve Board.
